sentence.Network_en: Light permeates the sheer petals of a Madagascar periwinkle.
sentence.Network_cn: 灯光透过了一朵马达加斯加长春花的纤薄的花瓣.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English peruince, from late Latin pervinca, reinforced in Middle English by Anglo-Norman French pervenke. The change of -v- to -w- and the addition of -le seem to have occurred before the appearance of periwinkle

entry.def: Periwinkle is a plant that grows along the ground and has blue flowers.
Periwinkles are small sea snails that can be eaten.

means.word_mean: 1. chiefly trailing poisonous plants with blue flowers
2. commonly cultivated Old World woody herb having large pinkish to red flowers
3. small edible marine snail; steamed in wine or baked
